title: Emmerdale spoilers: Cain discovers the full truth about Nate tonight
text:
Cain Dingle (Jeff Hordley) wasn’t in the least bit pleased to discover that Moira (Natalie J Robb) had been having a steamy affair with Nate Robinson (Jurrell Carter), but the even bigger shock came the following day, when — during his attempt at seeking revenge on the farmhand — he discovered that Nate is his son! Tonight, Cain learns the full truth about his son.

After becoming suspicious of Moira’s odd behaviour, Faith (Sally Dexter) put two and two together, and believed her daughter-in-law was having an affair with Pete (Anthony Quinlan). She informed Cain of her theory, and Cain proceeded to attack Pete — an altercation which resulted in Pete finally revealing that it was Nate whom his wife had been sleeping with.

Cain orchestrated a revenge scheme and after, getting Moira and Nate out on to a boat, he revealed to the farmhand that he was aware of the affair. A physical altercation ensued — during which Nate revealed that he is, in fact, Cain’s son.

The revelation left both Cain and Moira speechless, but they had little time to process the news, as Moira ended up in the water, and Cain jumped in to save her. Afterwards, the boat exploded, but Moira convinced her husband to save Nate — and he reluctantly did so, before leaving them there as he drove off.

Tonight, as Cain struggles to process everything that’s happened, he confronts Nate — and learns the truth about the man claiming to be his son. More specifically, he learns who the young man’s mother is.

The question is: how will Cain react to learning the truth?

What’s more, did he know he had another son out there? Or is this all fresh news to him?

Moreover, will Cain even care anymore?

Nate’s affair with Moira certainly isn’t the right way to build a father/son relationship, so — whether or not he knew of Nate’s existence could prove to be irrelevant — as he’ll likely want nothing to do with him after everything that has transpired.

Emmerdale continues Thursday 24thOctober at 7:30pm and 8:30pm.
